Description: Bronze figure of Apollo or a youth carrying pan-pipes in his left hand. The figure is in the style of a kouros with the left leg stepping forwards, but both feet flat on the ground. The hair is bound with a tainia and then falls in long locks over the shoulders and back. In the right clenched fist is a hole pierced right through, for the attachment of an unknown attribute. A strange lump marrs the crown of the head. The type is Athenian in origin.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Cairo (city) (acquired in Egypt but probably found in Greece)
Curator's comments: Possibly acquired in Cairo but may be Greek import.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Dr Daniel Marie Fouquet (sale)
Acquisition notes: Acquired in the sale as being purchased in Cairo from a Greek dealer. See the catalogue of the Fouquet Collection for more details.
